result.execSummary:
The defendant Jermel L Curry was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jermel L Curry is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jermel L Curry was found guilty of Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Surcharge], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: *Pay all mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges; including the DNA and DV surcharges to be paid during probation on case 15CF1900. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Consecutive to: To any other sentence. Court ordered credit be stipulated to the Court. Defense attorney did so. Defendant given 105 days credit. This will be a Time Served Disposition.
*Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jermel L Curry

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
From Atty. Patricia Padurean regarding sentence credit.
9/2/2015: Told attorney that 105 days credit were already applied to case 12CF1202. crt

Sentencing Proceeded. Statements made by parties and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1
The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 90 DAYS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence. Court ordered credit be stipulated to the Court. Defense attorney did so. Defendant given 105 DAYS credit. This will be a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court ordered defendant to pay all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges; including the DNA and DV surcharges, to be paid during probation on case 15CF1900. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Post Conviction relief.

AS TO COUNT 1 AMENDED
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form and Addendum, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

AS TO COUNT 2 AMENDED
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on motion of the state, court ordered count 2 Dismissed.

Defendant Jermel L Curry in court with attorney Patricia M. Padurean.  Defendant Jermel L Curry in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties have reached a resolution. Amended information, received and filed. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. 

AMENDED INFORMATION reads:
Count 1: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Temporary Restraining Order, Domestic Abuse Assessments, contrary to Wisc. Stats sec. 813.12(3) and (8)(a) and 973.055(1), a Class U Misdemeanor. 

COUNT 2: Misdemeanor Battery, Domestic Abuse Assessments, contrary to Wisc. Stats sec. 940.19(1), 939.51(3)(a), and 973.055(1), a Class A Misdemeanor.
Received and Filed, Speedy Trial Demand.

Attorney Patricia M. Padurean in court, defendant Jermel L Curry not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case remains calendared for Jury Trial in Branch 38 on 8-12-2015 at 8:15.   mld

Attorney Patricia Padurean appeared via telephonics, defendant Jermel L Curry not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Joseph Domask appeared on case 2015CF1900.    
For the reasons as stated on the record, Court allows Attorney Domask to Withdraw as Counsel on case 2015CF1900.  Attorney Domask to advise the Public Defender's Office, that Attorney Padurean will now proceed as defense counsel for both cases; 2015CF1202 and 2015CF1900.  Attorney Domask will send the discovery for case 2015CF1900 to  Attorney Padurean.  Case adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 7-24-2015 at 8:30 am and Jury Trial remains calendared for 8-12-2015 at 8:30 am.   mld

Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court, defendant Jermel L Curry not in court, in custody.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
FILE NOT IN COURT.

The Defendant currently has another case (2015CF1900), assigned to defense counsel, Joseph Domask.  Attorney Patricia Padurean is assigned as defense counsel to case 2015CF1202.  

DEMAND for Speedy Trial was entered by defense counsel, Joseph Domask on case 2015CF1900.  

Upon the motion of the State, with no objection by defense, Court ordered the following cases consolidated for the purposes of trial:  Case 2015CF1202 and 2015CF1900.  During proceedings, the clerk was unable to get in contact with  Attorney Padurean.  The State will follow-up and try to get in contact with Attorney Padurean, to determine if she will proceed as counsel of record for both cases, and if so, Attorney Domask would agreed to withdraw as counsel of record on case 2015CF1900.  Global offer was received by defense counsel.  Case adjourned for Status Conference in Branch 4 on 6-8-2015 at 8:30 am.  Case remains calendared for Jury Trial in Branch 4 on 8-12-2015 at 8:30 am.   EFFECTIVE AUGUST 3, 2015, THIS CASE WILL BE ASSIGNED TO THE HON. JEFFREY WAGNER, BRANCH 38, IN ROOM 504 OF THE COURTHOUSE.   mld

Defendant Jermel L Curry in court with attorney Patricia M. Padurean.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  FILE NOT IN COURT.  State informs Court and defense that they will be adding additional charges.  Defendant rejects state's offer.  Offer is hereby revoked.  Same conditions of bail to continue.  Jury trial scheduled for August 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jermel L Curry in court with attorney Andrew Rider for Patricia M. Padurean.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin. COURT FILE NOT IN COURT.  Defense needs to receive and review discovery.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jermel L Curry in court with attorney Patricia M. Padurean.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
BRANCH 40 FOR BRANCH 4.
ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.   Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 04.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for 03-31-2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Jermel L Curry
Current: 4138 West Orchard, Milwaukee, WI 53209   (Effective: 03-19-2015)
Prior: 4022 North 7th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53209
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

As an additional condition of bail:
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Dion A.    AND/OR  their residence     AND/OR  their place of employment

No dangerous weapons
No firearms

Defendant Jermel L Curry in court with attorney Lisa M. Procaccio.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
OCCR Tape #15-054

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
Court orders case adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 04.
Clerk:  jms
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 3/19/15 @ 1:30pm
